meanings.definition: A person who opposes or rejects popular opinion or established practices.
meanings.sent1: Some contrarians enjoy going against the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The contrarians in the group always have a different perspective.
meanings.sent3: The contrarians at the party decided to wear costumes instead of regular clothes.
meanings.sent4: She stood out like a contrarian in a sea of conformity.
meanings.sent5: The contrarians' unique viewpoints challenge the status quo.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a person who opposes or rejects popular opinion or established practices.
meanings.sent1: Her contrarian views often sparked interesting debates.
meanings.sent2: The contrarian approach to problem-solving led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent3: The contrarian fashion designer created a buzz with their unconventional designs.
meanings.sent4: His contrarian attitude made him stand out in the corporate world.
meanings.sent5: The contrarian perspective offered a fresh take on the issue.
